classmeta.shortdesc: A GtkObject representing an adjustable bounded value

desc.para: The GtkAdjustment object represents a value which has an associated lower and upper bound, together with step and page increments, and a page size. It is used within several GTK+ widgets, including GtkSpinButton, GtkViewport, and GtkRange (which is a base class for GtkHScrollbar, GtkVScrollbar, GtkHScale, and GtkVScale).
The GtkAdjustment object does not update the value itself. Instead it is left up to the owner of the GtkAdjustment to control the value.

The owner of the GtkAdjustment typically calls the value_changed and changed functions after changing the value and its bounds. This results in the emission of the value_changed or changed signal respectively.

desc.simpara: Creates a new adjusment object with the given parameters

desc.para: Emits a changed signal from the GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the GtkAdjustment after it has changed any of the fields other than the value.

method.shortdesc: Ensure that the value is in a certain range.

desc.para: Updates the GtkAdjustment value to ensure that the range between lower and upper is in the current page (i.e. between value and value + page_size). If the range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page. A changed signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

method.shortdesc: Gets the current value of the adjustment.

desc.para: Gets the current value of the adjustment.
See also: set_value, value
Sets the GtkAdjustment value. The value is clamped to lie between adjustment->lower and adjustment->upper.
Note that for adjustments which are used in a GtkScrollbar, the effective range of allowed values goes from adjustment->lower to (adjustment->upper - adjustment->page_size).
See also: get_value, value

method.desc: Emits a value-changed signal from the GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the GtkAdjustment after it has changed the value field.
